meanings.sent1: I saw many gooses at the park.
meanings.sent2: The farmer raised several gooses on his farm.
meanings.sent3: The gooses waddled around the pond, quacking happily.
meanings.sent4: The V-formation of gooses flying south was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The honking of the gooses echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of goose
meanings.sent1: She gooses when she sees her favorite treat.
meanings.sent2: The book describes how the character gooses in excitement.
meanings.sent3: The gooses in the story always find a way to help their friends.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter gooses through the room, spreading joy.
meanings.sent5: The gooses in the tale have magical powers.

meanings.sent1: He gooses his friend to get his attention.
meanings.sent2: The child gooses her sibling playfully.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy gooses the cat's tail.
meanings.sent4: The comedian gooses the audience with a witty remark.
meanings.sent5: The coach gooses the team to give their best performance.

meanings.definition: To increase the power or speed of an engine
meanings.sent1: The mechanic gooses the car's engine for better performance.
meanings.sent2: The pilot gooses the throttle to take off smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The racer gooses the motorcycle to zoom ahead of the competition.
meanings.sent4: The engineer gooses the train's engine for a faster journey.
meanings.sent5: The driver gooses the accelerator to overtake the other cars.
